Match the headings with the correct paragraphs (A–D).
options: The influence of culture on writing
The evolution from pictures to symbols
The continued importance of spoken language

items.label: A
items.text: A.	Writing systems developed as societies grew more complex. Early humans relied on spoken language, but as trade and administration expanded, permanent records became necessary. The earliest known writing systems appeared around 5,000 years ago in Mesopotamia and Egypt

questionText: Match the headings with the correct paragraphs (A–D).
options: The influence of culture on writing
The evolution from pictures to symbols
The continued importance of spoken language

items.label: B
items.text: B.	Initially, writing consisted of pictographs representing objects or ideas. Over time, these evolved into more abstract symbols, allowing complex thoughts to be recorded efficiently. This development played a key role in the advancement of law, science, and literature
items.correctAnswer: The evolution from pictures to symbols

questionText: Match the headings with the correct paragraphs (A–D).
options: The influence of culture on writing
The evolution from pictures to symbols
The continued importance of spoken language

items.label: C
items.text: Different regions created distinct writing systems. Alphabetic systems, such as those used in Europe, represent individual sounds, while logographic systems, like Chinese characters, represent words or meanings. Each system reflects the needs and history of its culture
items.correctAnswer: The influence of culture on writing

questionText: Match the headings with the correct paragraphs (A–D).
options: The influence of culture on writing
The evolution from pictures to symbols
The continued importance of spoken language

items.label: D
items.text: In the modern era, digital technology has transformed writing once again. Typing and electronic communication have replaced handwritten texts in many contexts. Despite this shift, writing remains a fundamental tool for communication and knowledge preservation.

questionText: Match the headings with the correct paragraphs (A–D).
options: The influence of culture on writing
The evolution from pictures to symbols
The continued importance of spoken language

items.label: E
items.text: Despite the importance of writing, spoken language has never disappeared. Oral communication continues to play a central role in daily interaction, storytelling, and cultural traditions. Even in highly literate societies, speech remains essential for social connection and the transmission of ideas.
items.correctAnswer: The continued importance of spoken language

Which paragraph (A–D) contains the following information?
options: Urban surfaces such as asphalt and concrete store heat, elevating local temperatures relative to rural areas
Sparse vegetation reduces cooling via evapotranspiration, exacerbating thermal retention.
Anthropogenic heat from transport and buildings compounds ambient temperature increases
Mitigation measures include reflective materials, green roofs, and expanded urban forestry.

items.label: A
items.text: Additional heat from vehicles and buildings
items.correctAnswer: Anthropogenic heat from transport and buildings compounds ambient temperature increases
